snippet: An antispam law requiring proof that a recipient has consented to be sent emails has resulted in a torrent of messages from companies, nonprofits and government agencies to everyone on their mailing lists.
abstract: Antispam law in Canada requiring proof that recipient has consented to be sent emails results in torrent of messages from retailers, manufacturers, nonprofits and government agencies to everyone on their mailing lists; companies are rushing to comply and verify that people want their accounts flooded with deals, discounts and announcements
lead_paragraph: An antispam law requiring proof that a recipient has consented to be sent emails has resulted in a torrent of messages from companies, nonprofits and government agencies to everyone on their mailing lists.

headline.main: Canadian Antispam Law Whips Up a Storm of Last-Minute Messages
headline.print_headline: Canadian Antispam Law Whips Up a Storm of Last-Minute Messages
